required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Gonadotrophin REceptor Polimorphisms on the Relationship Between Serum AMH and Ovarian Response
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Gonadotrophin REceptor Polimorphisms on the Relationship Between Serum AMH and Ovarian Response

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto Valenciano de Infertilidad, IVI VALENCIA

clinical_study.source: Instituto Valenciano de Infertilidad, IVI VALENCIA

brief_summary.textblock: Aim of study: To compare the relationship between serum AMH and ovarian response for IVF with the GnRH antagonist protocol in patients who are carriers of FSH and/or LH receptor polymorphisms with those that are not.

detailed_description.textblock:
Serum AMH has shown to have a high predictive capability of the ovarian response to stimulation for IVF. On the other hand, patients who are carriers of polymorphisms in the FSH and LH receptors, have shown to need higher doses of gonadotrophins for ovarian stimulation. The proportion of carriers has been described to be around 20% of the population. Nevertheless, the determination of these polymorphisms is not performed in routine practice. It is unknown if their presence affects to the relationship between serum AMH levels and ovarian response.
This is a prospective, single center, non-interventional, cohorts study.

primary_outcome.measure: Gonadotrophin receptor polymorphisms and ovarian response and AMH value
primary_outcome.description: To compare the relationship between serum AMH and ovarian response for IVF with the GnRH antagonist protocol in patients who are carriers of FSH and/or LH receptor polymorphisms with those that are not.

secondary_outcome.measure: polymorphisms in the FSH receptor (FSHR) variant N680S
secondary_outcome.description: To define the incidence of carriers of polymorphisms in the FSH receptor (FSHR) variant N680S (homozygous and heterozygous) among women undergoing ovarian stimulation for IVF.

secondary_outcome.measure: polymorphisms in the LH receptor (LHR) variant N312S
secondary_outcome.description: To define the incidence of carriers of polymorphisms in the LH receptor (LHR) variant N312S (homozygous and heterozygous) among women undergoing ovarian stimulation for IVF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Doses of gonadotrophin needed and polymorphisms
secondary_outcome.description: To analyse the doses of gonadotrophins needed for stimulation on each group of patients

clinical_study.condition: antimüllerian Hormone and Gonadotrophin Receptor Polymorphism as Predictors of Ovarian Response

arm_group.description: Infertile patients will undergo an ovarian stimulation with FSH and/or hMG. Doses will be chosen according to BMI, Antral follicle count, AMH and age.
Infertile patients will undergo an ovarian stimulation with FSH and/or hMG. Doses will be chosen according to BMI, Antral follicle count, AMH and age.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-45 years of age presenting to IVF clinic
- BMI of 18-35 kg/m2
- Having been tested for serum AMH with the Elecsys assay
- Being planned to undergo ovarian stimulation cycle for IVF with the GnRH antagonist protocol
- Signed written informed consent or waiver
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current or past disease affecting ovaries, gonadotropin or sex steroid
- Current hormone therapy

eligibility.gender_description: Only women will undergo an ovarian stimulation for IVF treatment

facility.name: Valencian Institute of Infertility, IVI RMA. Valencia
